children.name: clean
children.definition: done in a fair or legal way
examples: a good cleanfight/ contest

children.name: to treat someone or something in a way that is fair and shows their true qualities
examples: This postcard doesn't do justice to the wonderful scenery.

children.name: when a situation or decision is fair
the basic fairness of the judicial system
examples: ▪ News reports should be held to a high standard of accuracy and fairness.
▪ The judge has a record of fairness and non-discrimination.

children.name: justice
children.definition: fairness in the way people are treated, especially as the result of an official or legal decision: sự công bằngOPP injustice: công bằng, công lý
examples: Children have a strongsense of justice.
His people came to himdemanding justice.
▪ It’s up to the courts to uphold justice - you can’t take the law into your own hands.
▪ It is clear that ‘liberty and justice for all’ is still a goal rather than a reality in the U.S.

children.name: fair play
examples: 1playing according to the rules of a game without cheating :

children.name: rules designed toensure fair play
examples: A high level of sportsmanship and fair play is a tradition in the game.
2fair treatment of people without cheating or being dishonest :

children.name: the British tradition of fair play
examples: We need to instil in our children a strong sense of fair play.
This kind of behavior violates many people’ssense of fair play.
3 fair play to somebodyBritish English spokenused to say that you think what someone did was right :
He has to earn money somehow, so fair play to him.

children.name: treating people in an equal and reasonable way
fair-minded
children.definition: sb who is fair-minded is able to see situations in a fair and reasonable way and always considers other people’s opinions: công bằng, không thiên vị
examples: The Chairman is a fair-minded man, so will listen to any criticism of his proposals.
She remained maddeningly fair- minded, even about her greatest opponents.

children.name: fair
children.definition: 1 reasonable and acceptablea  situation, system, way of treating people, or judgment seems reasonable, acceptable, and rightOPP unfair: hợp lý, phải lẽ, chơi đẹp
examples: All we are asking for is a fair wage.
£150 is a fair price.
fair trial/hearing
the right to a fair trial
What do you think is the fairest solution?
The report is a fair summary of the issues facing us.
it is fair to do sth
It seems fair to give them a second chance.
it is fair that
Do you think it’s fair that she gets paid more money than me?
it’s only fair (that)(= used to say that it is right to do something )
It’s only fair that we tell him what’s happening.
it’s fair to say (that)(= used when you think what you are saying is correct or reasonable )
It’s fair to say that by then he had lost the support of his staff.
it’s not fair on sb
I can’t carry on working such long hours. It’s not fair on my family.
2 treating everyone equallytreating everyone in a way that is right or equalOPP unfair: công bằng, đối xử công bằng
Why does Eric get to go and I don’t?It’s not fair!
Life isn’t always fair.
Kelson has a reputation as a fair and compassionate judge.
Despite the discrimination they suffered, my grandparents remained fair, decent, good people.
be fair to sb
The old law wasn’t fair to women.
I’ve always tried to be fair to all my children.
In order to be fair to everyone, ticket sales are limited to two for each person.
it’s only fair (that)
You pay him $10 an hour – it’s only fair that I should get the same.
My boss expects a lot – but he’s very fair.
to be fairspoken say this when you are giving a reason why sb should not be criticized too strongly: công bằng mà nói
To be fair, these are complicated, serious issues, and the department has only been discussing them for a short time.
fairly[adv] B2
I believe I acted fairly when I expelled those students.
He claimed that he hadn't beentreatedfairly by his employers.
Officials will ensure that the election is carried out fairly.

children.name: reasonable
children.definition: if an agreement, offer, or what sb does is reasonable, most people would agree that it is fair and sensible: hợp lí
examples: The company made every reasonable effort to correct the problem.
The students’ goals in the protest seem so reasonable that the university is setting up a committee to consider them.

children.name: it is reasonable to do sth
examples: Do you think it’s reasonable to expect people to work more than 60 hours a week?

children.name: just
children.definition: a situation, decision etc that is just gives someone what they rightly deserve or have a right to expect: công bằng, công minh
examples: Many of us did not feel that the court’s decision was just.
a just and lasting peace
just decision/punishment/settlement etc
The Attorney General called the sentence a fair and just punishment for someone who had committed such a dreadful crime.

just[adj] written sb who is just treats people in a way that is fair and right - use this especially about leaders, rulers, and other people in authority, especially in historical descriptions: công minh
He was the perfect choice for Emperor -- just, patient, merciful and of royal blood.
No just government would allow this kind of treatment of its own citizens.

children.name: balanced
children.definition: giving fair and equal treatment to all sides of an argument or subject: hợp lí
examples: ‘Newsweek’ gave a reasonably balanced report on the crisis.
Recently historians have taken a far more balanced view of the Irish question.

children.name: even-handed
children.definition: giving fair and equal treatment to everyone, especially when it would be easy to favour one particular group: không thiên vị
examples: The drama takes an even-handed look at the consequences of violent crime, both on attackers and their victims.
The film is even-handed and does not try to make you support either side.

children.name: fair’s fair N
children.definition: fair’s fair/ˌfeəʳz ˈfeəʳ/ spoken use this to tell someone that they should do something because it is right and fair, especially after you have done something for them: có qua có lại
examples: ▪ Come on, fair’s fair. It’s your turn to mind the kids.

children.name: play fair
children.definition: to do sth in an honest and fair way: chơi đẹp
examples: ▪ The film company says that it played fair in all its contract dealings with the actors’ unions.
▪ A mystery novel should play fair with the reader, providing all the clues necessary to solve the crime.
